subject: Admission to 'Certificate Course in Sanskrit Language' and 'Diploma Course in Sanskrit Language'
body: Dear all, Please see the following email on the Sanskrit language courses. A wonderful opportunity! The instructor and Faculty in charge Dr. Ramakrishna U are CC'd. Thanks. ---------------------- Namaste to All, Under the guidance of Central Sanskrit University, New Delhi, IIT Hyderabad presents a golden opportunity to learn Sanskrit, the mother of all traditional languages. The Center for Sanskrit Learning (CSL) at IIT Hyderabad is hosting another round of courses, including a basic Sanskrit course on campus. These courses are open to everyone—students, faculty, staff, their families, and even individuals outside of IITH. Anyone who has passed the 10th standard is eligible to enroll. This course is designed to be convenient, making it easy to speak, read, and write Sanskrit. Additionally, participants will learn to recite verses, sing in Sanskrit, and engage with various moral stories in the language. The CSL is offering two specific courses: a 'Certificate Course in Sanskrit Language' for beginners, and a 'Diploma in Sanskrit Language' for those who have completed the first course. Don't miss this golden opportunity to immerse yourself in the rich tradition of Sanskrit. Two courses are being offered: Certificate course and Diploma course. Diploma course is only for learners who have passed the certificate course. This Certificate Course at IITH is recommended for beginners and will focus on a graded learning method, with flexibility where the students can decide their pace and joining. There are absolutely no prerequisites for joining this course. More details are available in the attached poster. Registration Link: https://csucsl.samarth.edu.in/ Last date of registration: 20 Sept. Please contact the instructor of this course for more questions. Namaste, Course Instructor: Shri. Biswarup Bej Phone: +91 9749084988 श्रीमान् विश्वरूप-वेजः/ Mr. Biswarup Bej Instructor, Centre for Sanskrit Learning of CSU Department of HST IIT Hyderabad, Block-A-717 F ---------------------- Regards, Kousik Sarathy Sridharan, PhD *Associate Professor & Head, * *Dept. of Heritage Sci. & Tech.* *IIT Hyderabad* -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Resume for intern at Credit systems India
Re: Abstract Submission Deadline for IIM ATM 2025 – 20th September
body: Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars, and Students, Further to my earlier email about abstract submissions, I would like to clarify the dates for IIM ATM 2025: *The 79th Annual Technical Meeting of the Indian Institute of Metals (IIM-ATM 2025) will be held at IIT Hyderabad from 3rd to 6th December 2025.* Please continue submitting your *abstracts by 20th September 2025* and mark your calendars to ensure your availability during the conference. Looking forward to strong participation from all departments! Thanks and Regards, Saswata ======================================================= *Saswata Bhattacharya* *শাশ্বত ভট্টাচার্য্য * *Professor and Head of Department* *Department of Materials Science and Metallurgical Engineering,* *Office - 101, Materials Science Building,* *Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, * *Kandi, Sangareddy - 502284,* *Telangana, INDIA.* Ph: +91 8331036023. On Mon, Sep 8, 2025 at 7:11 AM Head-Materials Sc & Metallurgical Eng < head@msme.iith.ac.in> wrote: > Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars, and Students, > > On behalf of the Core Organizing Committee, this is to remind you that the > last date for abstract submission for IIM ATM 2025 is *20th September > 2025.* > > *IIM ATM is India’s flagship national and international conference > subject: Abstract Submission Deadline for IIM ATM 2025 – 20th September
body: Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars, and Students, On behalf of the Core Organizing Committee, this is to remind you that the last date for abstract submission for IIM ATM 2025 is *20th September 2025.* *IIM ATM is India’s flagship national and international conference covering the entire spectrum of Materials Science and Engineering* — *from critical minerals and extractive metallurgy to advanced materials (alloys, ceramics, polymers, composites), advances in manufacturing technologies, physical and mechanical metallurgy, energy materials, functional materials, ICME (Integrated Computational Materials Engineering) and AI/ML applications in materials research, computational modeling, and Industry 4.0 applications in materials and manufacturing.* *This year’s event is of special significance, as it is being hosted at IIT Hyderabad, and our Director is serving as the President of IIM.* This is a moment of pride for our institution and an excellent opportunity to showcase our research and innovation on a national and international stage. We warmly invite participation from all related departments — Materials Science and Metallurgical Engineering, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, AI, Physics, Chemistry, and all allied disciplines — to submit abstracts and represent our institution strongly at this prestigious gathering. *Please submit your abstracts well before the deadline of 20th September to avoid last-minute issues.* Submission guidelines and details are available at: https://iimatm.in/ Let us make our presence felt and ensure that our institution is prominently represented at this landmark edition of IIM ATM. Thanks and Regards, Saswata ======================================================= *Saswata Bhattacharya* *শাশ্বত ভট্টাচার্য্য * *Professor and Head of Department* *Department of Materials Science and Metallurgical Engineering,* *Office - 101, Materials Science Building,* *Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, * *Kandi, Sangareddy - 502284,* *Telangana, INDIA.* Ph: +91 8331036023. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Re: Implementation of 24×7 Library Access as Promised
body: Dear friends, I am committed to keeping the library open 24x7. I told this to our Librarian almost 3 months back. However, we needed additional staff for this and I approved additional staff. The library has now acquired the additional staff. *I want the library to start functioning 24x7 from September 15th.* However, only certain sections of the library will be open after 12 midnight for easy monitoring. I hope the students will use it for the purpose for which the Library is meant for. Anyone who misuses this opportunity provided will not have access to the library. To the best of my knowledge, there are very few academic institutes in India (or possibly none) where the library is open 24x7 (except for the exams time) and we are making this exception for our institute to provide opportunity to those who want to make use of this opportunity for study purposes) . warm regards, Murty ************************************************ प्रो. बी.एस. मूर्ति/ Prof. B.S. Murty निदेशक/ Director भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान हैदराबाद, कंदी, संगारेड्डी-502284 Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, Kandi, Sangareddy-502284 Email: bsm@iith.ac.in; director@iith.ac.in Phone: +91-40-2301 6002; +91-83310 36001 ************************************************ On Sun, 7 Sept 2025 at 17:37, Nukavarapu Yaswanth Sai < ch25mtech11010@iith.ac.in> wrote: > Respected sir, > > During orientation, you assured us that the library would soon be made > open 24×7. It has now been more than a month, and the timings remain > restricted to 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM. This is not in line with the commitment > made to students. > > The current schedule forces students towards late-night study hours, while > completely neglecting those who prefer early mornings, which research shows > are actually more effective for learning (Schmidt et al., 2007, *Chronobiology > International*). > > If single rooms were provided, students could have managed by studying in > their rooms at any hour. But with double sharing, switching on the lights > early in the morning directly disturbs roommates, making it impossible to > study in the hostel. > > In this situation, the library is the only proper study space. Restricting > its availability in the mornings leaves us with no practical option. The > promise of 24×7 access was not just desirable; it was necessary, especially > given the living conditions provided. > > We therefore strongly request that the administration immediately > implement 24×7 access to the library, as was assured to us during > orientation. > > This is about fairness, honouring commitments, and ensuring that all > students, regardless of their study schedules, have equal opportunity to > use the library. > > I sincerely hope you will keep your word and ensure that this promise is > fulfilled without further delay. > > Sincerely, > Nukavarapu Yaswanth Sai > CH25MTECH11010 > > Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one > of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM. > -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

Look into > the camera, and *make it unscripted*. Why? Because I can read you. I know > when it’s real, your expressions, your pauses, your genuine energy, that’s > what matters. > > *Because, When you hold the mic, you hold the audience.* > You have the authority to *manipulate their thoughts*, not with lies, but > with words, confidence, and timing. > > *Humour isn’t about jokes, it’s about perspective.* > The same things we all see, *you must say differently.* Everyone knows > the world is broken, only you know *how to break it better*. > > *Look into their eyes.* > Fear is temporary. *Your impact, Permanent.* > You’re not just a good person to interact with, you're the *best person > to entertain. And that matters.* > > Let’s begin with trials. Submit your entries. > > *Remember:* > Roasting isn’t joking, it’s speaking the *unsaid truth*. > Funny? Good. > Serious? Iconic > > I hope you’ve got the idea by now. subject: Greetings and Call for Ideas for Academic Transformation@IITH
body: Dear Students, Greetings from the Office of Academics Affairs at IIT Hyderabad and congratulations to all the students community for IITH achieving all time highest 7th Rank at NIRF under the guidance and leadership of our Director. On behalf of academic office, we thank all the on roll 5751 (UG:PG=41:59) and graduated 8589 (UG:PG=38:62) students for their hard work in publishing quality research articles and participating in prestigious and innovative competitions and hackathons. Thanks to different students clubs which have played crucial role in keeping the students activities and academic creativity go in parallel. As you know, any great Institutions like world's number one MIT and India's number one IIT Madras are able to maintain the highest standing among all of the Institution primarily due to the creative and innovative academic activities, quality research publications (Q-factor), and development of technical solutions for the nation and the world at large. While many of you are doing hard work towards achieving some of the above goals to some extent, I am sure many of you, like me, willing to see IITH also in the league of those Institution in the years to come! It is a proud moment of all of us what we have achieved in shorter span of 17 Yrs but need lots of discipline and measured direction to achieve the excellence in academics like other great Institutions. Though, we have had prestigious Universities like Nalanda, we are on the path of making our Indian Institutions great again. While doing so I would like to remind you that even University like Allahabad University used to be called Harvard of East, the quality of the Institution started degrading due to lack of discipline by the students and others at the helm! As we are on the path of creating history by promoting innovative and creative teaching methodology, interdisciplinary programs, Industry based research problems, hands-on activities based on NEP, hackathons, inviting companies, national and multinational, to open their offices in Technology Research Park and to give Industrial lectures, Joining hands with foreign and Indian Institutions to train the manpower of current and future technologies for taking the Indian Economy from 4th to 3rd in the world. While we perform our duties, we expect your active involvement in the pursuit of achieving the goals of the Institute as well as the Nation in serving the humanity at its best! While we go upward to the peak of the mountain, any deviation from the goal will make us fall back. Therefore, I encourage you to take the leadership role with hard work, perseverance and most important disciplined approach in achieving your goal of excellence in academics and other activities. To achieve this goal of academic excellence we invite you to share with us ideas on how to transform academics at IIT Hyderabad for all of us! I will end of message with an old saying which describes the quality of a best student: *श्लोक *(Shloka): *काक चेष्टा, बको ध्यानं, श्वान निद्रा तथैव च । अल्पाहारी, गृहत्यागी, विद्यार्थी पंच लक्षणं ॥ * *English Version*: *Kaak cheshta, bako dhyanam, shwan nidra tathaiva cha. Alpahari, grihtyaagi, vidyarthi panch lakshanam* *English Meaning*: Effort of a crow, concentration of a crane (or heron), light sleep like a dog, eating less, and less involvement in home matters—these are the five characteristics of a student. *Further Description*: Kak chesta: The effort or tireless endeavor of a crow. Bako dhyanam: The intense, focused concentration of a crane. Shwan nidra: The light, alert sleep of a dog, which wakes up at the slightest sound. Alpahari: One who eats only as much as is needed. Grihtyagi: One who renounces the comforts and attachments of home Thank you very much and looking forward to your active involvement in academic activities to make the learning fun and beneficial to all of you for which you are the part of the IITH community. Please do not hesitate to write to me any ideas that you have which can be implemented to achieve the best environment for teaching and learning. Best wishes, Prof. Ashok Kumar Pandey Dean (Acad), IIT Hyderabad Office: 408 Admin Block -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: LLM API access for CS3530 Assignment 1
body: Hello, The access information and instructions for the LLM instance for your assignment 1 of the course is given below. *Access information (to be accessed only from the server):* - IP address : 192.168.50.142 - Port: 25000 *Instructions:* 1. Use HTTP requests to access the API 2. The LLM instance only supports up to 24 students at a given time. Therefore a reservation based mechanism is used. Format is given below. 3. Reserve the instance by sending a HTTP request to the url *http://{ip address}:{port}/reserve* containing a JSON body that has your roll number with "rollno" key as shown below. 4. Sample JSON for reservation: { "rollno": "cs24mtech12007" } 5. Each student gets upto 30 minutes at a time. Also the LLM reservation is voided after 5 minutes of idle time. 6. To generate a quiz, use the url *http://{ip address}:{port}/generate_quiz *with the JSON body as shown below. 7. A sample of generate quiz JSON is as follows: { "rollno": "cs24mtech12007", "messages": [ { "role": "system", "content": ( "You are a trivia generator. Given a genre, output exactly 10 multiple-choice " "questions. Each question must have 4 options (A, B, C, D) and one correct answer. " "Return ONLY valid JSON in the following format: " '{"questions":[{"q":"...","options":["A) ...","B) ...","C) ...","D) ..."],"a":"A"}, ...]}' ) }, { "role": "user", "content": f"Generate 10 MCQ trivia questions about science." } ], "temperature": 0.0, "max_tokens": 1200 } To avoid clashes in the server(192.168.50.111), please use the port numbers as follows for your server to listen to: - CS students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers - EE students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 1000 - ES students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 2000 - MA students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 3000 Please note that high load on the LLM instance significantly increases the query processing time. Last minute rush may lead to errors. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

body: Dear All, Hope you are doing well. Please find below a few important instructions for the Online Assessment scheduled tomorrow: 1. Ensure you have signed up on *InterviewBit * using your institute email ID. 2. Keep your *resume ready* to upload on the portal before the test. (Please upload the same version that was submitted on the OCS portal.) 3. Notebooks are *not allowed*. You may bring only a few sheets of paper. Bags must be placed in front of the classroom, with mobile phones kept inside on silent mode. 4. Keep your *IIT Hyderabad ID card handy*, placed on the table facing upwards. 5. Students who already have their internships confirmed are *not allowed to appear for the OA*. We request you to kindly follow the above instructions carefully to ensure a smooth and fair assessment process. subject: Lunar Eclipse Observation Session
from: "'Cepheid Astronomy club' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body: Dear Astronomy and Astrophysics Enthusiasts, We hope this email finds you well and full of curiosity about the mysteries of the universe! Prepare for a once-in-a-lifetime celestial show! Cepheid, the Astronomy Club of IITH, is excited to extend a special invitation to you for an exclusive observation session of the Total Lunar Eclipse, a rare event that will grace the night sky tomorrow, *September 7th, 2025*. Our telescopes will be aimed on the moon , providing stunning, close-up views. No prior knowledge is required, just bring your sense of wonder! Here are the details: - *Date:* Sunday, September 7, 2025 - *Venue:* C-Block Terrace - *Time:* 10:00 PM to 11:30 PM *Important Note on Timing:* - *Partial Eclipse Begins:* ~9:57 PM. - *Total Eclipse (Blood Moon) Begins:* ~11:00 PM. - *Maximum Eclipse:* ~11:41 PM We're thrilled at the prospect of taking a cosmic break with you. This is a perfect opportunity to step away from your studies and connect with the cosmos. We can't wait to share this incredible experience with you. See you under the moonlit (and shadowed) sky! Clear skies, [image: Photo] *CEPHEID* *The Astronomy Club* IIT Hyderabad cepheid@gymkhana.iith.ac.in +91 77383 50253 +91 76191 14781 -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

body: Dear All, Hope you are doing well. We are pleased to inform you that the Online Assessment (OA) for *Media.net* is scheduled as part of the ongoing internship drive. subject: INTER IIT 🏆💪: Fashion Selections
body: Hey Everyone, The selections for *Fashion at Inter-IIT Culturals 8.0* are now open! IIT Hyderabad will be participating in this year’s edition hosted at *IIT Kanpur*, and we are looking for passionate participants to represent us. There are *two exciting opportunities* this time: *1. Online Modeling Competition* A themed shoot showcasing style, creativity, and individuality. This will be conducted online and requires participants who can bring fashion to life through expressive posing and visual storytelling. *2. Fashion Show* An on-ground show where we need: - *Models* to walk the runway - *Backstage Crew*, including: - 👗 *Stylers & Outfit Makers* – designing, styling, and managing looks - 💄 *Makeup Artists* – creative and stage-ready looks - 🎛️ *Lighting & Sound Team* – managing stage setup and ambiance - 🛠️ *Tech *– integrating technology in fashion show outfits. 📅 *Form Deadline:* *7th September* 🎤 *Auditions:* *8th September* 👉 Fill out the form here Let’s make a mark at Inter-IIT 8.0! For any queries, please reach out to* Nidhi Battini (9370999343)* Thanks & Regards, *Navin Joshi* Cultural And Literary Secretary, Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026 +91 9340256954 -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: New announcement: "Somebody wanted.a notational…"
body: Notification settings CS5590/CS3390 New announcement Somebody wanted.a notational clarification, which may help all .. so posting For surrogate losses we overloaded notation. while loss takes two labels, surrogate losses take as input reals so we used notation like l(f(x),y) i.e., l( sign(g(x),y) but actually it is a function of g(x) and y . This is just for notational convinience. Otherwise l(sign(g(x),y) cannot represent a surrogate like hinge loss as arguments take only label values. in summary, when we write l ( sign(g(x), y ) we actually mean a function of g(x) and y, which is according to the surrogate. Hope this clarifies. This notation was used in summary notes too. See details Posted on 3:51 PM, Sep 6 (GMT+05:30) by Saketha Nath Jagarlapudi Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA This email was sent to you because you indicated that you'd like to receive email notifications from Google Classroom. If you don't want to receive emails like this, you can unsubscribe or change your settings .

subject: Offline Essay Writing & Drawing Competition – 7th September 2025.
body: Dear Students, Hope you are doing well! *NSS IIT Hyderabad is pleased to announce an Offline Essay Writing and Drawing Competition.* As a new initiative this year, we are focusing on the lesser-known aspects of the Indian Constitution and the hidden applications of its Articles that often go unnoticed. We have also been sharing a series of related posts on our social media platforms. Continuing this effort, we are now organizing an *Essay Writing Competition* on constitutional themes, along with a *Drawing Competition* on cleanliness awareness. We invite all interested students to participate in this event and showcase their creativity and perspectives, whether by exploring the hidden applications of the Constitutional Articles through essays or by spreading awareness on cleanliness through drawings. *Event Details:* 📅 *Date:* 7th September 2025 ⏰ *Time:* 4:30 PM – 6:00 PM 📍 *Venue: ALH1 & ALH2. * *Essay Writing Competition:* *Theme * *Article 24 – Prohibition of Child Labour in Hazardous Employment:* *Topic: “Why a 14-year-old cannot work in a factory but can help in a family business.”* *Word Limit:* 1000 – 1500 words 📌 *Note: Mobile phones are not allowed during the competition.* *Drawing Competition:* *Theme:* *“My Campus, My Responsibility”* – cleanliness in hostels, classrooms, and surroundings. Participants may use images from the internet as references. 📌 *Note: Please bring your drawing materials. You may bring your drawing sheets, or A4 sheets will be provided.* *This competition is open to all students, and participation hours will be allotted under Category 2.* We look forward to your enthusiastic participation in making this event a success! -- ---------------------------Regards--------------------------- [image: Photo] nss.iith.ac.in/ National Service Scheme (NSS) Indian Institute Of Technology, Hyderabad +91 7013561424 | 9490313586, +91 7396037140, +91 7702360623, +91 8247207978, +91 8919736038 office.nss@iith.ac.in [image: Banner] [image: phone-icon] *NOT ME BUT YOU* [image: facebook icon] [image: youtube icon] [image: linkedin icon] [image: instagram icon] -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: INTER IIT 🏆💪: WORD GAMES APPLICATION
body: Hey everyone, The selections for *Word Games* at *Inter-IIT Culturals 8.0* are now open! We are looking for participants to represent IIT Hyderabad in the upcoming edition hosted at IIT Kanpur. If you have prior experience in the following events, please do apply through the form below: *Cryptic Crossword* A crossword puzzle where each clue is a word puzzle in itself, involving definitions, anagrams, hidden words, or other forms of wordplay. The solver has to interpret the clues correctly to fill the grid. *Scrabble* A board game in which players use letter tiles to form words on a grid. Each letter carries a score, and players aim to maximize their points by placing words strategically on premium squares. *Sacred Word Games* A set of word-based puzzles and challenges (such as anagrams, word rearrangements, or logical word problems) conducted under a fixed time limit. These are designed to test vocabulary, reasoning, and quick thinking. Fill the form here: FORM LINK *Deadline to fill the form: 11:59 PM, Sunday (07 September 2025)* Those who have filled the form will be sent a mail separately regarding further process after the deadline is over. For any queries, please reach out to Rohith (7538867625). Thanks & Regards, *Navin Joshi* Cultural And Literary Secretary, Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026 +91 9340256954 -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Security information for student organized events
body: Dear Students, I hope you are aware of the recent racing bike event, which was not organized appropriately. In case of any unwanted situation, it will be challenging to manage the crowd/vehicles' movement/parking with the current resources. The student coordinators usually come with the approval of the concerned FIC/faculty without the liability and responsibility for unwanted cases. At the end, we get a sorry email from the organizers after damaging the reputation of IITH. If you arrange any event as a coordinator, the security section here will help you conduct the same. But, first, please consult with CSO to assess the security requirements, which depend on the number of participants, vehicle entries, vehicle parking, etc. Approval must be obtained from FIC(Security) by the coordinator well before time, subject to following the appropriate security arrangements suggested by the CSO. The coordinator and organizers will be responsible for any unwanted situation. Further, the following orders from the competent authority has to be followed without fail. ------- 1. Any activity by the students related to sports should be recommended by the FIC (Sports) with a clear proposal on the details of the participants, program and funds/sponsorship and should be approved by the Dean(students) in a written form. 2. Any activity by the students other than sports should be recommended by the FIC (SA)/FIC(students' club) with a clear proposal on the details of the participants, program and funds/sponsorship and should be approved by the Dean(students) in a written form. ---------- The commercial nature and outside agency participation of the event have to be declared. Please avoid bringing a large number of participants, and note that we can't deal with any number of outside participants without appropriate preparation. Further, please do not expect the approval if requested just a few hours before the event. bcc all students and faculties for information. Best Prof. Bhabani Shankar Mallik FIC (Security) -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Thanks for taking the  UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26)
body: UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26) - Submission Confirmation Hello, Thanks for completing ** UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26)**. We've sent your submission to **UiPath - Robotic Process Automation**. In the meantime, you can go ahead and solve more of such code challenges on [HackerRank](https://www.hackerrank.com/dashboard?h_r=hrw&h_l=confirmation_email&utm_source=hrw&utm_campaign=confirmation_domains&utm_medium=email). Solving code challenges is a great way to keep your skills sharp for interviews. Wish you all the best for your test result! 🤞 This is an automated message. Please **do not** reply to this. You'll need to contact **UiPath - Robotic Process Automation** directly for any follow-up questions. Thanks, ** HackerRank Team** PS: HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the challenges. It does not schedule or evaluate any hiring challenges or conduct interviews for any company. Please directly contact the company that sent you the invite for such purposes.

subject: Orientation Session – Deccan AI Project-Based Internship

body: To the IITH community, Please see the specialty and homeopathy clinic visits for next week (10/09/2025 to 13/09/2025) also available on Intranet. SPECIALTY CLINICS Date Day Specialty Consultant Name Timings 10.09.2025 Wednesday General Medicine Dr Alfia Rachel 3.00 pm to 5.00 pm 11.09.2025 Thursday Gynecology Dr Shabnam 10.00 am to 12.00 pm Radiology Dr Balaji S Dermatology Dr Neha 3.00 pm to 5.00 pm Dental Surgeon Dr Rathod Balaji 4.00 pm to 6.00 pm ENT Dr P. Suresh Kumar Psychiatrist Dr Vijay Kumar Bandaru 5.00 pm to 7.30 pm 12.09.2025 Friday Ophthalmologist Dr Vasantha 2.00 pm to 4.00 pm Orthopedician Dr Babul Reddy 4.00 pm to 6.00 pm 13.09.2025 Saturday General Medicine Dr Alfia Rachel 10.00 am to 12.00 pm Institute Specialist Doctor Name Specialty Timings Dr Baishakhi Chandra Pulmonologist As per Institute duty roaster Dr Sonia Pediatrician As per Institute duty roaster HOMEOPATHY Date Day Timings 10.09.2025 Wednesday 10.00 am to 1.00 pm 13.09.2025 Saturday 10.00 am to 1.00 pm *Please Note* ** Referral from an Institute medical officer is mandatory before getting an appointment.* ** Call 8331036233 between 9:00 am - 5:30pm to book a slot.* ** Carry your medical book for all medical appointments and a copy of your Aadhar card if an Obstetric scan is needed. * ** Inform hospital staff if you want to cancel your appointment, allowing other members of the community to obtain an appointment with the specialist.* -- *Thanks & Regards,* *Administration**/ **प्रशासन* *Hospital office** /**अस्पताल* *कार्यालय* [image: IITH Logo] -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Re: BT2040 Class Contents
Re: Meet ServiceNow 2025 | Mandatory Registration for September 8 Sessions
body: Dear Students, This is a follow-up regarding *Meet ServiceNow 2025*, scheduled for *September 8, 2025*. *Important Update:* Due to multiple requests, the sessions are now *open to all branches* of the 2027 graduating batch (B.Tech). 🔹 *Eligibility:* All B.Tech 2027 Grads with *CGPA ≥ 7* 🔹 *Sessions:* Orientation, Interview Readiness & Networking (exclusive session) Compulsory Registration If you have not yet registered, kindly complete the forms at the earliest: 1. *Orientation & Interview Readiness* (mandatory for all participants) 🔗 Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Orientation | IIT Hyderabad 2. *Networking Session (exclusive, limited seats)* 🔗 Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Networking Session *Deadline:* *September 5, 2025* We request all eligible students who haven’t registered yet to *fill the above forms immediately* to confirm participation. On Tue, Sep 2, 2025 at 1:37 PM Shubham Nare wrote: > Dear Students, > > Greetings, We are excited to announce that *Meet ServiceNow 2025* will be > hosted on *September 8, 2025*, featuring three engaging sessions for the *2027 > graduating batch (B.Tech - *CS, IT & Circuit branches*)*. > Session Details > Session Time Duration > Orientation 10:30 AM – 11:30 AM 60 mins > Interview Readiness 11:50 AM – 12:35 PM 45 mins > Networking (Exclusive) 2:00 PM – 2:45 PM 45 mins > Compulsory Registration > > 1. > > *Orientation & Interview Readiness* > All students attending these sessions must *compulsorily register* > using the link below: > 🔗 Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Orientation | IIT Hyderabad > > *Deadline:* *September 4, 2025* > 2. > > *Networking Session (Exclusive)* > Interested students must also fill the separate form below. A few will > be selected for this exclusive session: > 🔗 Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Networking Session > > *Deadline:* *September 4, 2025* > > We look forward to your enthusiastic participation in making this event a > success. > > -- > > *Thanks and Regards,Shubham Nare* > Internship Coordinator, > Office of Career Services, > Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, > Phone : +91 7249792394 > Email : ic23btech11020@iith.ac.in > > -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Re: Registration Open: UiPath – Software Engineer Intern (Female Candidates Only)
body: Dear All, Please note that the *branch eligibility is now open to all branches* and there is *no CGPA barrier* for this opportunity. We encourage all interested and eligible students to register at the earliest. A reminder that this internship is* open exclusively to female candidates*. Regards, Harsh Vardhan Singh On Fri, Sep 5, 2025 at 1:55 AM Harsh Vardhan Singh < ep23btech11012@iith.ac.in> wrote: > Dear All, > > I hope this message finds you well. > > We are pleased to inform you that *UiPath* is inviting applications for > the *Software Engineer Intern* role as part of the ongoing internship > drive. This opportunity is *open exclusively to female candidates*. > > *Position:* Software Engineer Intern > *Eligible Branches:* B.Tech – CS/IT and relevant branches > *Graduating Year:* 2027 > *Eligibility:* CGPA 7.0 and above > *Stipend:* INR 1,50,000 per month > *Relocation Support:* INR 1,00,000 > *Location:* Bangalore / Hyderabad > > *Registration:* > All interested and eligible students are required to register via the > following Google Form > > *Deadline to Register:* *5th September 2025, 2:00 PM* > > *Online Assessment:* *5th September 2025, 7:00 PM* (Further details will > be shared shortly) > > *Note:* The HR team has informed us that the positions may be opened to > all candidates at a later stage. > > *PFA* the JD for the same > > Regards, > > Harsh Vardhan Singh; 9449578710 > -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Total Power Cut off on 06.09.25 ( Saturday ) from 0630 H to 0730Hrs for upcoming Solar Power Generation Plant-reg
body: Dear all, Under the provision of Solar Power Generation at IITH campus, a new 550 KVA Compact substation is coming up at Parking No.1 ( Main Gate). Laying of HT 11KV cable from CSS to MRS 11 KV panel room is in progress. Part of the Cable ( near about 50 meter) has to be laid inside of the Distribution 11 KV HT panel at MRS. The said 11 KV HT UG Cable is to be drawn through the existing tunnel which is having other feeder HT Cables in live mode. As a factor of safety a power shut down is required for one hour to complete this work. *Hence there will be NO power to the entire Campus from 0630 Hrs to 0730 Hrs on 06.09.2025 ( Saturday ). * During this power shutdown NO main power (EB) and NO DG Backup will be available across the IITH campus . However one lift in each of the existing FTs and STs will be functional on emergency back up. In view of the above it is requested to kindly plan your activities accordingly Cooperation of all is solicited. Thank You With Regards, Altaf Hussain AE ( Elect) CMD, IIT Hyderabad *8500066866 * *Construction and Maintenance Division, * *Indian Institute of Technology, Hyderabad. * *Kandi, Sangareddy (Dist), **Telangana,* *Landline no. 040-2301 6796.* -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Sunshine's Suicide Prevention Week 2025: A Week of Hope and Connection at IITH
from: "'Sunshine IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body: Dear IITH Community, In observance of *World Suicide Prevention Day on September 10th*, Sunshine, the Counselling Cell is hosting *"Suicide Prevention Week 2025"* from September 8th to September 12th. This week is dedicated to raising awareness, fostering a supportive community, and encouraging open conversations about mental health and well-being. We believe that through collective action and connection, we can create an environment on campus where everyone feels seen, heard, and supported. We invite you all to participate in the week’s activities. Your presence and engagement can make a profound difference. *Schedule of Events:* Date Day Event Time Venue Sept 8th Monday Random Acts of Kindness *5:30pm* New Mess Lawns Sept 9th Tuesday Random Acts of Kindness *5:30pm* Near Library and LHC Sept 10th Wednesday *Sunshine Strides* *6:00 AM* Hostel Circle to IITH Main Gate Sept 10th Wednesday Heal Out Loud *5:30pm* *TBD* Sept 11th Thursday Random Acts of Kindness *5:30pm* Old Mess Lawns Sept 12th Friday Random Acts of Kindness *5:30pm* Near C Block and CSE building *About Our Events:* - Random Acts of Kindness: Participate in a unique experience of connection. Share a kind note with a stranger and witness the simple power of a positive message. - Sunshine Strides: Start the day with a refreshing *morning walk* to promote mental and physical well-being and stand in solidarity as a community. To register, please Click here - Heal Out Loud: An open mic session facilitated by Sunshine. This is a safe and non- judgmental open space for sharing stories, life experiences or thoughts related to your mental health journeys. Lend your voice or your ear in an evening of community and catharsis. All events are open to every member of the IITH community. *For Event-Related Queries* - Name: *please contact the Counsellors* - Contact:* 8331036080,8331036081,8330136082* Let us come together to create hope through action. We look forward to your participation. Warm regards, Sunshine Team -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Fwd: Onam Celebrations | EBSB
Inter IIT Comedy Trials 🏆💪 - Stand-up and Improv
body: *Inter IIT Comedy Trials* *The coolest among the culturals.* Stand-up and improv comedy trials are beginning, and we’re kicking things off with *online submissions* to judge your roasting and humour talent. You’ll need to attach a *video clip* to the form linked below. *Choose your own topic and roast it*, up to a *maximum of 3 minutes*. Look into the camera, and *make it unscripted*. Why? Because I can read you. I know when it’s real, your expressions, your pauses, your genuine energy, that’s what matters. *Because, When you hold the mic, you hold the audience.* You have the authority to *manipulate their thoughts*, not with lies, but with words, confidence, and timing. *Humour isn’t about jokes, it’s about perspective.* The same things we all see, *you must say differently.* Everyone knows the world is broken, only you know *how to break it better*. *Look into their eyes.* Fear is temporary. *Your impact, Permanent.* You’re not just a good person to interact with, you're the *best person to entertain. And that matters.* Let’s begin with trials. Submit your entries. *Remember:* Roasting isn’t joking, it’s speaking the *unsaid truth*. Funny? Good. Serious? Iconic I hope you’ve got the idea by now. It’s time to tackle your fear of the stage, introversion (like me, myself), and that *unchallenged attitude* you've been sitting on for too long. Let’s show people what you can be, and what you’ve always had to say, with the *perfect confidence and zero fear* of the listeners. ------------------------------ That’s all. I used my GPT free trial till here, and to explain more, it’s asking me to upgrade to premium. *Not gonna happen.Form Link : *https://forms.gle/oX9YvcsTpUN3uhm27 *Deadline : Sunday , 7 Sept ' 25* Thanks and regards, *Shubham Dadhich* 8741879391 Comedy Cup Captain, *Inter IIT Cultural Meet 8.0* -------------------------------------------- Thanks & Regards, *Navin Joshi* Cultural And Literary Secretary, Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026 +91 9340256954 -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Launch of Hostel Complaints Google Form- Kind Attention
body: Dear Student, We hope you are doing well. This is to inform you that a *Google Form for Hostel Complaints* has been launched to streamline the process of addressing issues in the hostels. *Please note:* - *Only complaints submitted through this form will be considered.- Hostel complaints form * - The complaint form is available on the *Hostels website*.-HCU The step by step procedure and feasibility with this complaint form are provided below for your reference. 1. This form will be enabled only for candidates who have been allotted hostels. 2. Any complaint related to the various issues (like Civil, Electrical, Room, Water Purifier, Washing machine,Pest control, Carpenter, LAN, Hygiene, Furniture etc. ) can be raised through this complaint form only. 3. After raising the complaint , a unique complaint ID (example: *HC-CIV-250904-VHM-0320-000000)* will be created for the complaint raised and will get the acknowledgement on the same to your mail id. 4. You can track the status of the complaint with the help of complaint ID and there is no need to send the mail separately for the status of the complaint. 5. Once the complaint has been resolved, you will get the email and you can acknowledge the same. We encourage you to make use of this system for faster and more organised resolution of hostel-related complaints. *NOTE: Kindly refrain from sending emails regarding hostel-related issues to the office.hostel@iith.ac.in email ID. Instead, please use the designated form provided for this purpose.* Thank you for your cooperation. छात्रावास समन्वय इकाई | Hostel Coordinating Unit मंडप ब्लॉक (टीटी रूम के बगल में) | Pavilion Block (Beside TT Room) भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान, हैदराबाद, कंडी - 502284 | IIT Hyderabad, Kandi - 502284 तेलंगाना, भारत। | Telangana, India. Phone | फ़ोन: 040-2301 6833, 040-2301 6822 email | ईमेल :office.hostel@iith.ac.in Website | वेबसाइट:http://hostel.iith.ac.in/ -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

from: "'Tinkerers' Lab IIT-H' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body: *Hey Freshers,*We’re thrilled to invite you to *TinkerFresh* — a three-day immersive experience designed to spark your curiosity and help you explore the tools shaping tomorrow’s innovations. Whether you’re passionate about coding, electronics, or the latest tech trends, *TinkerFresh* is the perfect platform to learn, build, and explore. Here’s what’s in store: 🔹 *Day 0* – Intro to Mechatronics & Arduino | LaTeX: Formal Writing 🔹 *Day 1* – Data Analytics with Python | Intro to Machine Learning 🔹 *Day 2* – Working with Linux | Git & Version Control 📅 *Dates:* September 6, 7, 8 📍 *Venue & timings:* To be announced shortly ✨ Get ready to experience the *burst of technology* in every session. We can’t wait to see you there! [image: photo] Regards, Team TL Tinkerers Lab, IIT Hyderabad tl@campus.iith.ac.in [image: instagram] [image: facebook] [image: linkedin] -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Fwd: [Shizuoka Univ.] International Exchange Program Spring 2026 Announcement
body: Dear Students, The following is the opportunity announced by Shizuoka University, Japan!. Kindly check the complete details and apply if interested. Please see the links below for the fact sheet and additional information. https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/ Becoming Exchange Student https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student /becomingexs FAQ https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student /faqexs Student Testimonials https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student /student_testimonials The nominations with the below information and approval letter by your HoD / Supervisor / Department should reach us by *15:00 , 22nd September* . As we have to send only 3 nominations from IITH there would be shortlisting done bycommitte Name Department Roll NO Mobile number CGPA Do you have a valid Passport currently Mention your Passport Number and Validity For any Query Please fil this form by , 12th September . we will answer periodically . https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iRoHJonRPL7k8k6ISfiI33GxSy_bA8IuojJRPYf0ZHk/edit?gid=1368971935#gid=1368971935 Please note : The Approval Letter from your Supervisor or HoD for the period spent in Japan is necessary to consider your nominations to Shizuoka . **Shizuoka University accepts student applications through our partner universities . Direct applications from students will not be accepted.* Regards Pranitha.A --------- Dear Partners, (Please extend this email to the appropriate colleagues) Warm greetings from Shizuoka University, Japan! We are excited to announce that nominations for the Spring 2026 International Exchange Program are now open! Please see the links below for the fact sheet and additional information. (English) https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/ (Japanese) https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student/ Becoming Exchange Student https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/becomingexs FAQ https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/faqexs Student Testimonials https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student/student_testimonials 1. Acceptable number of students: up to* 3* (The number on the basis of our agreement.) The number of students that can be accepted is calculated by subtracting the students who will continue their exchange from the Fall semester of 2025. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us. 2. Nomination (Deadline: October 1, 2025) Please include the following information in your email and send it to us. - Nominee name(s) - Email address(es) of the nominee(s) - Term(s) in which the nominee(s) intend to study at our university. Nominees may choose to study for either one semester or two semesters. One term: 6 months (from April 1, 2026 to September 30, 2026) Two terms: 1year (from April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027) e.g. Mr. ***** ***** *****, XXXX@XXXX, 1 term Ms. ********** *****, xxxx@xxxxx, 2terms * Nominations will only be accepted through the partner university office via email. 3. Application (Deadline: October 14, 2025) *The application procedure has been revised starting this time.* Each nominated student is expected to complete the application individually through the *online system*. Detailed instructions will be provided separately to the nominated students. 4. Result The results will be announced in December We sincerely thank you in advance for your great cooperation. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us. Best regards, -- 瀧 奈緒 Nao TAKI (Ms.) ┏ ──────────────────── ┓ 静岡大学 国際課 International Affairs Section, Shizuoka University P: 054-238-4260 ┛ -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Fwd: [UOsaka_re-sending] University-wide incoming exchange programs 2026 Spring intake
body: Dear Students, Greetings ! The following is the information regarding the *Osaka University (OU)* exchange program for students , *2026 Spring** intake.* *Exchange study tracks (* *2026 Spring* *intake): iExPO, OUSSEP, FrontierLab, Maple* *Maximum number of students to receive (2025 Spring intake) : 2* *IITH's Nomination deadline: 14:00 , Septemebr 15th , 2025* Please download the application guide for students and coordinators from the following link, which is also available to download from the log-in page of the online system. [Nomination information guides] https://filesender.nii.ac.jp/?s=download&token=936fee3b-beec-4bc3-870e-b609855d62d1 *Once we check & finalize the nominations . The initial authentication password for the further(online application) process would be given by our office(**only to the selected students) **.* We would like to settle the above deadline and *no extension is possible* . It is mandatory for your HoD/ Department / supervisor to approve your durations of time spent at Osaka University( for this program) hence forward it with their approval . The *Approval Letter* from your Supervisor or HoD for the period spent in Japan is necessary . *It is recommended to read all the details in the attachment & website thoroughly(FaQ's Videos etc.) , don't expect response for queries that are already explained clearly *. For any further queries you may kindly reach out to our coordinator copied on the mail first . Excel sheet for queries : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iRoHJonRPL7k8k6ISfiI33GxSy_bA8IuojJRPYf0ZHk/edit?gid=1368971935#gid=1368971935 . We will answer all queries as one FAQ response to this thread . To encourage you to read much before the deadline and avoid last minute rush , the last date for filling / asking queries is *10.09.25* University contact : exchange@ciee.osaka-u.ac.jp . Regards Pranitha.A Dear Partner, Greetings from the University of Osaka. We are happy to inform you that our online application web page is now ready to nominate university-wide exchange students *for 2026 Spring intake.* *The University of Osaka currently receives exchange applications for university-wide programs twice a year, for September and April intake. Please DO NOT nominate stu­dents for 2027 Fall intake at this time.* *Please note that we may not be able to accept all nominated students if the number of stu­dents in each program exceeds capacity to accommodate. We appreciate your under­standing on this matter in advance.* Please download the application guide for students and coordinators from the following link, which is also available to download from the log-in page of the online system. [Nomination information guides] https://filesender.nii.ac.jp/?s=download&token=936fee3b-beec-4bc3-870e-b609855d62d1 Contract type: University-Wide Exchange study tracks (2026 Spring intake): iExPO, OUSSEP, FrontierLab Maximum number of students to receive 2026Spring intake : 5 Nomination deadline: September 30, 2025 Student’s application deadline: October 13, 2025 Student authentication password: AJ5gAGrL *Please inform necessary application materials to your students well in advance, especially language proficiency score/certificate and give the initial authentication password to the nominated students.* When you submit your nomination online, an instruction email will be sent to your students. The application guide and forms are all available to download from the student’s personal ap­plication web page. [Number of Accepted International Students for the University-Wide Exchange Program] We start counting the exchange place from September in our university-wide incoming student exchange programs. We basically consider the total number of students sent from your institu­tion in a year from September to August, regardless of full-year or half year study. If you need further information about your sending students or online nomination, please con­tact us at exchange@ciee.osaka-u.ac.jp . We are looking forward to your nomination! Best Regards, ------------------------------------------------ The University of Osaka University-wide Student Exchange - Inbound team International Student Affairs Division Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: IITH is at 7th rank in NIRF Engineering.
body: Dear friends, You are all aware that we have been at 8th rank, behind the 7 first gen IITs for quite some time. We have always been dreaming of breaking this barrier. Today we realised our dream and got 7th rank in engineering today. We have crossed an IIT, which is 13 years older than us (IIT Guwahati). Today is a very special day for all of us. The credit goes to all of you, faculty, students and staff. Thank you so much for your passionate contributions to your institution. Let's keep moving forward with a commitment to excel and make IITH the dream destination for everyone. warm regards, Murty ************************************************ प्रो. बी.एस. मूर्ति/ Prof. B.S. Murty निदेशक/ Director भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान हैदराबाद, कंदी, संगारेड्डी-502284 Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, Kandi, Sangareddy-502284 Email: bsm@iith.ac.in; director@iith.ac.in Phone: +91-40-2301 6002; +91-83310 36001 ************************************************ -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Fwd: BASKETBALL INTER IIT TRIALS
body: FYI ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Mathew M Philip Date: Thu, 4 Sept, 2025, 12:16 Subject: BASKETBALL INTER IIT TRIALS To: Kowsith Gurubilli Dear Students, This is to inform you all that due to exams scheduled for first year students we have postponed the trials to *Friday evening - 05/09/2025 .* We are excited to announce the trials for probables of forming the Men’s & Women's Basketball team for the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet scheduled to be held in the month of December at IIT Madras. The trials will be conducted under the guidance of our Coach Ms Ruchi Yadav and are open to all students. Kindly note the updated timings of the trials. Details of the Trials: Date: *05.09.2025 (Friday)* Time: *5:00 pm to 7:00 pm* Venue: SNCC Basketball Court Dress Code: Shorts & T-shirt Sportswear with non-marking shoes (Mandatory) The selected players will constitute the official Institute Basketball Team, which will represent our institute at the Inter IIT Sports Meet as well as in practice matches and other tournaments throughout the year. The team will also have daily training sessions to prepare for the upcoming tournaments. We encourage all interested students to participate to showcase their talent. This is a great opportunity to play competitive basketball and represent our institute. We sincerely invite you all on behalf of our coach and the old team members, and we look forward to your participation. Please note that the SNCC Basketball Court will be reserved for Inter IIT team practice from today (04.09.2025) until December, from 6:30 PM to 9:00 PM daily. For any queries, contact: Mathew – 8089040111 Anjali – 9406815374 Best regards, Mathew M Philip Coordinator,Basketball IITH Thanks & Regards / सादर धन्यवाद Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: New announcement: "Important instructions for all exams:…"
body: Notification settings CS5590/CS3390 New announcement Important instructions for all exams: 1. Reach atleast 10minutes before the exam to the venue. 2. Dont carry any mobile/electronic-gadget/book/notes. You need to only bring your ID card and pen/pencil and nothing else. 3. If an invigilator finds that there is a mobile/electronic-gadget/book/notes that is withinyour reach during the exam (for e.g., switched o phone in your pocket), then you will be awarded zero marks in this quiz (even if you are not using the resource). 4. If you are found to be using any of these resources orany other unfair means, it will lead to a fail grade as announced earlier. 5. Writing beyond announced end time will result in zero marks for the quiz. So please immediately stop writing answers as soon as the invigilator announces so. 6. Usually question paper is distributed few minutes before so that you can read all the instructions in the question paper. Seating arrangment will be shared soon. See details Posted on 10:41 AM, Sep 4 (GMT+05:30) by Saketha Nath Jagarlapudi Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA This email was sent to you because you indicated that you'd like to receive email notifications from Google Classroom. subject: Fwd: Scholarship for girl students pursuing professional graduation courses| Kotak Kanya Scholarship 2025-26
body: Dear Students, Forwarded for your information. Interested and eligible students may apply, others, please ignore this email. *Note:* Students should avail only a single scholarship / stipend / financial aid, only from a single stakeholder for a given period i.e. Students cannot avail multiple scholarships / financial assistance from multiple stakeholders (Govt. / Private / any external agencies) for the same academic year. *Disclaimer : IITH is not related to this organisation or the scholarship schemes offered. You are, therefore, requested to check the authenticity of the organisation before applying.* Regards, Scholarships Team / छात्रवृत्ति टीम Academic Section/शैक्षणिक अनुभाग Room No. 004, Ground Floor/कमरा नंबर 004, भूतल Administration Block /प्रशासन ब्लॉक IIT Hyderabad/आईआईटी हैदराबाद Kandi, Sangareddy/कंडी, संगारेड्डी Telangana/तेलंगाना - 502284 Ph: 040 2301 6767 ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Buddy4Study Date: Wed, 3 Sept, 2025, 15:00 Subject: Scholarship for girl students pursuing professional graduation courses| Kotak Kanya Scholarship 2025-26 To: Dr. Sayantee Jana *Scholarship of INR 1.5 lakh per year | Requesting support for the circulation of this message * Dear Dr. Sayantee Jana , Greetings of the day! We hope you received our previous communication regarding the *Kotak Kanya Scholarship 2025-26. *The scholarship is currently open for girl students who have completed Class 12 and are currently enrolled in government schools/colleges. Program details are shared below for your reference. *Eligibility: * - Open for meritorious girl students across India. - Applicants must have scored 75% or more marks or equivalent CGPA in Class 12 board examinations. - Applicant's annual family income must be less than INR 6,00,000. - Meritorious girl students who have secured admission to the first year of graduation programs in the academic year 2025-26 in institutes of repute like NIRF/NAAC accredited for professional graduation degrees like Engineering, MBBS, Integrated LLB (5 Years), Integrated BS-MS/BS-Research, in ISER, IISC(Bangalore), or other professional courses (Design, Architecture, etc.). *Award:* Scholarship of INR 1.5 lakh* per year *Application Deadline:* September 30, 2025 *Application URL: http://www.b4s.in/a/em_KKGS4_20250624_1 * *Helpline: *kotakscholarship@buddy4study.com or 011-430-92248 (Ext-262) Kindly share this scholarship information with students in your institution so that they can take advantage of this opportunity. If you have any queries or need any assistance regarding this scholarship program, please contact us. You can also download the poster of this scholarship program by clicking on the link below. Download Program Poster *About Buddy4Study* Buddy4Study is India’s largest scholarship platform and student empowerment network, with more than 1 crore registered students. Since its inception in 2011, Buddy4Study has been dedicated to simplifying access to scholarship information, making it easily available to the student community. The platform collaborates with India’s leading corporate houses, offering technology-driven solutions to help them fulfill their CSR obligations by enabling scholarship opportunities and providing learning solutions. Currently, Buddy4Study partners with top corporate brands such as HDFC Bank, Wipro, Colgate-Palmolive, Aditya Birla Capital, and LIC HFL as a CSR implementation partner. To date, the platform has empowered more than 1,28,000 students, facilitating scholarship disbursements exceeding ₹631 crore. Best Regards, *Team Buddy4Study* ------------------------------ Copyright © 2011 Buddy4Study, All rights reserved. Our mailing address is: info@buddy4study.com Buddy4Study (Workly), A - 14/15 3rd Floor, Sector 59 Noida – 201309 Uttar Pradesh, India. Do not wish to receive further updates, unsubscribe from this list. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: UK Government’s Fully-Funded Chevening Scholarships & Fellowships - REGISTER NOW for Virtual Awareness Session
body: Dear Students, The British High Commission is pleased to announce that applications for the UK Government’s prestigious *Chevening Scholarships and Fellowships* for the *2026-2027 academic year* are now open! *What’s on offer?* - *Fully funded scholarship to study one-year Master’s *at any UK university, in any course of your choice. - *Short-term thematic fellowships* in: - Leadership - Cyber Security - South Asia Journalism - Science & Research - Arts *📅 Application Window: **5 August – 7 October 2025* Know someone with the potential to lead change in their community or globally? Encourage them to apply and become part of a global network of future leaders. *Apply now*: Apply | Chevening *Join the Info Sessions!* To support prospective applicants, we’re hosting online sessions packed with insights on eligibility, the application process, and tips for success. Hear from the Head of Chevening and get a chance to ask your questions directly. *Session Dates:* - *Wednesday, 10 September August | 3–4 PM* 📌 *Register is mandatory by 5th September to receive the free joining link*: Microsoft Virtual Events Powered by Teams Thank you, Regards Azmath Office of International Relations IIT hyderabad -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

body: Hello, Greetings from the LitSoc! We are excited to announce that the *Inter IIT Speaking Arts* trials are on *6th September, Saturday*! If you are passionate about spoken word, quick thinking, and powerful expression, this is your chance to represent our institute at the Inter IIT Cultural Meet. Categories include: • JAM (Just A Minute) • Debate • Poetry (Spoken Word/Recitation) • Elocution Whether you’re a seasoned speaker or looking to challenge yourself on a new stage, we encourage you to participate. 📅 Trial Dates: *6th September* 📍 Venue: *To be announced* 🕒 Timings: *To be announced* Please fill out the following form to register for the trials: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSflOuITuzaFB4zS0bxFt0nXWAterKitOkOWlcJAs9ELT4IN-A/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=112224106766854550336 For any queries, feel free to reach out to: Sinchan Jha (Debate Society Head) 9876216715 Yuvraj Singh (Debate Society Co-Head) 9123026671 -- ------------------------------------------------------------------ WhatsApp - WhatsApp Community Blog - The Lexicon IITH Discord - https://discord.gg/j6aTYMe Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/litsoc_iith/ Magazine - https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1jcmqqtMsQxYBP9pxlcuJK82Pwxw-DE5E?usp=sharing ------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Re: Register for Cisco Summer Internship Program – Batch of 2027
body: Reminder for the *Cisco Online assessment at 8 P.M* On Wed, Sep 3, 2025 at 5:48 PM Bolla Lokesh Reddy wrote: > Please find the *seating arrangement for the Cisco Internship Online > Assessment (OA)* scheduled to be conducted *today at 8:00 PM*. > > > https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1n1wO_SoenDt9VOfPAoIeMGmbsKfrcfXpwnuSTC2eKA4/edit?usp=sharing > > *Important Instructions:* > > - > > Only students who have received the *OA details and link from Cisco* > are required to attend and write the test. > - > > Students who have not received the OA details should *not attend* the > assessment. > - > > Kindly ensure you are seated in your allocated room as per the > arrangement shared in the attached sheet. > > > On Tue, Sep 2, 2025 at 8:51 PM Bolla Lokesh Reddy < > cs23btech11011@iith.ac.in> wrote: > >> Dear Students, >> >> Cisco has sent *Online Assessment (OA) invitations via HackerRank* to >> all eligible students on their registered email IDs. >> >> 📌 *Important Note:* >> >> - >> >> If you did not receive the mail, it could be due to *wrong email ID, >> academic arrears, or not being of Indian nationality*. >> - >> >> Please *check your Spam/Junk folders* as well. >> >> 📝 *Assessment Details:* >> >> - >> >> *Date:* 03 September 2025 >> - >> >> *Start Time:* 08:00 PM >> - >> >> *End Time:* 09:30 PM >> - >> >> *Duration:* 90 minutes >> - >> >> *Platform:* HackerRank >> >> 📌 *Instructions for Students:* >> >> - The assessment will consist of coding-based questions; ensure that >> they have a stable internet connection throughout the assessment. >> - The use of any study material, mobile phones, electronic devices, >> media, or internet resources is not >> - allowed during the test. >> - No calculators are allowed. Using a pen and paper is allowed during >> the test. >> - Please ensure that the students have a built-in camera on the >> system they are taking the test from. >> - The test will run on full-screen mode, please ensure that they do >> not exit the window, switch tabs as >> - this may flag as suspicious activity. >> - Any sort of copying, plagiarism, moving out of the tab/window, or >> malpractices will lead to disqualification. >> - The activity during the assessment, including code submissions and >> browser behaviour, may be >> - monitored for integrity checks. >> - Students should refrain from copying code from external sources. >> - Students should avoid switching between tabs or windows during the >> assessment. >> - Any detected irregularities may be subject to further review and >> could impact their assessment outcome. >> - Any unfair means used during the assessment will lead to >> elimination from the process and further >> - course of action will be taken against the student. >> - In case of a power cut or network disconnection, Please ask the >> student to resume/rejoin within 30 minutes, or else the test will be >> automatically submitted. >> - The test will automatically be submitted after 30 minutes of >> inactivity on the test screen. >> - To rejoin the test, the students should use the same email address >> used to register on HackerRank. >> >> 📌 *Seating Arrangement:* >> >> Seating arrangement details will be shared shortly. >> >> Best regards, >> *B.Lokesh Reddy* >> >> On Sat, Aug 23, 2025 at 8:49 AM Bolla Lokesh Reddy < >> cs23btech11011@iith.ac.in> wrote: >> >>> Final Reminder, >>> Submit the forms and ocs registration before the deadline. >>> >>> No extensions will be allowed. >>> >>> On Fri, 22 Aug, 2025, 11:18 pm Bolla Lokesh Reddy, < >>> cs23btech11011@iith.ac.in> wrote: >>> >>>> *Final Reminder* – Submit All 3 Cisco Internship Registrations 🚨 >>>> >>>> Dear All, >>>> >>>> 🔴 Please ensure you complete *all 3 steps* for Cisco Internship >>>> Registration before the deadline. >>>> >>>> 📌 *Deadline: 23rd August 2025, 10:00 AM* >>>> ⚠️ No extensions. Submissions after the deadline will NOT be accepted. >>>> >>>> On Thu, Aug 21, 2025 at 10:36 PM Bolla Lokesh Reddy < >>>> cs23btech11011@iith.ac.in> wrote: >>>> >>>>> Dear All, >>>>> >>>>> 🔴 This is the *final reminder* for the Internship Registration >>>>> process for *Cisco*. >>>>> >>>>> ⚠️ *Mandatory Requirements (Strict):* >>>>> >>>>> 1. >>>>> >>>>> *Company's Official Portal* >>>>> 2. >>>>> >>>>> *Google Form* >>>>> 3. >>>>> >>>>> *OCS Portal Registration* >>>>> >>>>> ✅ *If you have already filled the 2 forms, please ensure OCS Portal >>>>> registration is done before the deadline.* >>>>> ✅ *If you haven't filled out the forms until now, you must complete >>>>> all 3 steps.* >>>>> >>>>> 📌 *Final Deadline:* *23rd August 2025, 10:00 AM* >>>>> >>>>> 🔴 *No extensions will be given beyond this. subject: Re: Qurve Orientation 2025
body: Dear Students, Due to several requests, we are changing the date for the orientation. The updated timing will be shared soon. Thank you, *With regards,Medha and Akansha,* *Qurve Overall Coordinators* On Wed, 3 Sept, 2025, 2:47 pm Qurve IIT Hyderabad, wrote: > Dear Students, > > We are delighted to invite you to the *Orientation of Qurve*, the > official *LGBTQ+ Alliance of IIT Hyderabad*! > > Whether you are a member of the LGBTQ+ community, an ally, or simply > curious to learn more, this is a *safe and welcoming space* to connect, > share, and celebrate diversity. > > Event Details: > 📅 Date: 4th September 2025 > 🕒 Time: 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm > 📍 Venue: A - Block Auditorium > > Join us to: > > - Learn about Qurve, our mission, and upcoming initiatives > - Meet and interact with fellow students and allies > - Explore ways to make our campus a more inclusive and supportive > space for everyone > > For any queries or if you wish to connect with us, feel free to reach out. > > Looking forward to seeing you there! > > > *With regards,Medha and Akansha,* > *Qurve Overall Coordinators* > > -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. body: Dear all, Due to the critical academic activities which need Wi-Fi to be shut down in the Lecture Hall Complex, the Wi-Fi access for B.Tech, M.Tech, Ph.D., Guest, and Eduroam will be terminated today at any moment till around 8:30 PM IST. subject: One Nation One Subscription (ONOS) User Awareness Programme on Unlock the Future of Research: GenAI & ScienceDirect in Scholarly Publishing - REG
body: Dear Sir/Madam, It is pleased to announce that INFLIBNET Centre is organising One Nation One Subscription (ONOS) User Awareness Programme on Unlock the Future of Research: GenAI & ScienceDirect in Scholarly Publishing in collaboration with Elsevier on 9th September 2025 at 3 to 4 pm. This session will provide researchers with a comprehensive understanding of how Generative AI is reshaping scientific publishing, highlighting both the opportunities and challenges it presents. Registration Link: https://webinars.elsevier.com/elsevier/generative-ai-genai-in-scientific-writing-and-scholarly-publishing-and-sciencedirect-for-onos *Agenda:* - GenAI in Publishing: Opportunities and Concerns - Legislative and Policy Landscape for AI - Elsevier’s GenAI Policies and Responsible AI Principles - Compliance for Authors, Editors, and Reviewers - Elsevier’s GenAI-Powered Tools for Researchers and Clinicians - Navigating ScienceDirect *Hosts*: Prof. Devika Madalli (Director, INFLIBNET), Aishwarya Nayal (Customer Success Manager, Elsevier), Dr. Anirban Basu (Scientific Editor, Elsevier), Nicholas Pak (Customer Success Team Manager, South Asia and South-East Asia, Elsevier) Regards, Team KRC Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM. -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: INTER IIT 🏆💪: Musical Events Auditions
body: Dear All, Vibes, the music club is looking for people to represent the college at Inter IIT which will be held at IIT kanpur this year(December 24-28). If you’re passionate about music, this is your chance to show your skills. Auditions will be held live at the music room. *Prepare a 5 min song/piece to perform.* We’re holding auditions for the following events: *1.Battle of Bands* *2.Solo Singing* *3.Classical Singing* *4.Pair on Stage* *For singers: * *10th September 9pm onwards.* *For instrumentalists:* *11th September 9pm onwards.* *Venue: Music room* Bring your best performance, energy, and enthusiasm. Looking forward to seeing you there, Team Vibes For any queries, contact Raghav - 85230 05115 Amogh - 96633 50216 Kshiteesh - 76248 13999 Thanks & Regards, *Navin Joshi* Cultural And Literary Secretary, Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026 +91 9340256954 -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Re: Regarding CA1048 course registration
body: Dear Students, The course CA1048 - Samskritam: Sambhashana Praveshah (1 credit) is opened for students registrations. It is scheduled in 34 segments and the slots available for registrations are 67. Interested students are encouraged to register within the add/ drop period. The requests to add/ drop the courses are strict to the rules applicable for add/ drop courses. subject: Kiriith, Vol - 7, Issue 1 - Materials Characterisation
body: Dear all: Greetings of the day! We are happy to share KirIITH Issue 1 of Volume 7-Materials Characterisation research at IITH. Sincerely, Prabhat Kumar *Director's Desk - Prof B S Murty* As always, this edition, Vol 7, Issue 1, Jan - Mar 2025 (Issue - 22) is dedicated to one of IITH's key thrust research areas, "Material Characterisation". In today’s rapidly evolving world of technology, material characterisation plays a vital role in driving innovation, ensuring reliability, and enhancing performance across industries. As new materials are developed for cutting-edge applications, from semiconductors and renewable energy to biomedical devices & aerospace, understanding their structural, mechanical, electrical, and chemical properties becomes essential. *Flip Over* *Read More* *Articles* *KID: 20250101 * Facilitating Faculty to Propel Sponsored Research and Consultancy Activities. A step towards building IITH as a Global Leader Prof G Narahari Sastry *Download * *KID: 20250102* CERBRUS: From Atoms to Applications – Our Journey in Materials Characterisation Prof Saswata Bhattacharya *Download * *KID: 20250103* From Bragg to Rietveld: A century of X-Ray Diffraction and 50 years of structural refinement [1] Ms Sruti Muralikrishnan [2] Mr Manish Chandra Joshi [3] Prof Ranjith Ramadurai *Download * *KID: 20250104* From learning to living: "Shh... what's happening deep in there [1] Mr Sukesh Kumar [2] Dr Mudrika Khandelwal *Download * *KID: 20250105 * Green Steel: Building a cleaner future [1] Dr Ashok Kamaraj [2] Dr Ramesh Kumar [3] Ms Kakara Sripushpa [4] Mr Bharat Kumar [5] Mr A. Ashish Babu & [6] Mr B Lakshman Kumar *Download * *KID: 20250106* Greenwashing Alert: Is Your Bamboo Product Truly Sustainable? body: Dear Students Hope you are doing well. We are excited to announce that applications are now open for the *Canteen Monitoring Committee (CMC) – Coordinator positions for the academic year 2025-26.* The CMC plays a key role in ensuring smooth operations and continued improvement of our campus dining spaces. We are looking for committed and enthusiastic individuals who are eager to contribute, take initiative, and work in a collaborative environment. You may apply for a Coordinator position in one of the following domains: *1. Inspection Team Coordinator**2. Technical Team Coordinator* *Eligibility Criteria:* - Minimum CGPA: 6.5 - Must be a full-time registered student of the institute. - Should have no disciplinary record or negative feedback from faculty/staff. - Should be a positive role model in the student community. Please go through the *attached document * for detailed roles and responsibilities before applying. We look forward to seeing proactive students step up and make a meaningful contribution through the CMC. Form -> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSczSjGepoloAtGIWO6o1vXqtmiY-Ec6KzQ3AOydSNBs4KUq2w/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113149730704166021925 Best regards, Thanks & Regards ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ *Krishna Vardhan Pitla* *General Secretary-I* *Student Gymkhana 2025-26* *Mobile: ** 7989400829* -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH. subject: Access to IITH KRC/Library Online Resources
body: Dear Student, We are happy to inform you that the IITH Knowledge Resource Centre (KRC)/Library has subscribed to a wide range of e-resources to support your learning and research. These include: Full-text databases, e-books, Individual journals, Bibliographic databases, Online newspapers, and Academic tools. In addition, our Institute is a part of The One Nation One Subscription (ONOS) initiative, further enriching the resources available. You may access these resources through: Summon - web-scale discovery products{Single Search}: https://iith.summon.serialssolutions.com/ *IITH KRC Subscribed e-resources **for off-campus acces*s: https://identity.iith.ac.in/ (Please use your AIMS Login ID credential ) We encourage you to explore and use these resources for academic and research activities. IITH non-subscribed resources: Please fill out and submit the article requisition form to get the desired documents (article/book chapter/ book) from our network libraries ( For IITH non-subscribed resources). सादर/ regards Jayanta Kumar Sahu *Website | Catalog |RAIITH |Pragyaan | Search * *ज्ञान संसाधन केंद्र* / *Knowledge Resource Centre (KRC)* भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान हैदराबाद, कंधी, संगारेड्डी-502284 Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad Kandi, Sangareddy, Telangana-502284 |INDIA Phone: 040-23016750 | e-Mail: office.library@iith.ac.in -- Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one of the users of IITH.
